brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve
      stimulation as a complementary therapy is effective in the treatment of pediatric epilepsy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transcutaneous Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation for Pediatric Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: Transcutaneous Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation as a Complementary Treatment for Pediatric Epilepsy

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 8, 16, 24 weeks respectively in frequency of epileptic seizures

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: China  Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of TVNS intervention, an expected average of 8 weeks"

clinical_study.source: China  Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

lead_sponsor.agency: China  Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
